feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: DEFAULT VALUES FOR GENERATION OF OPERATIONS CONFIGURATION SUPPORT
entry.content: We are facing the issue while creating production order with our material for rework order type with custom order type by using the app ‚Äúproduction order without material-create‚Äù.  Here we are facing the challenge that default values for generation of operation configuration is not available. As we are trying it is not available to add new entries.

entry.title: Wait Time not available in production order operations API
entry.content:
A minimum Wait Time is visible for each production order operation in SAP. This wait time is not available in any production order operation API endpoint (API_PRODUCTION_ORDER_2_SRV). Can this field be added to the endpoint, or is there an alternative endpoint?

I know the value is available via the routing endpoint (API_PRODUCTION_ROUTING;v=0003), but this endpoint returns the base value in the routing, not the actual value in the production order operation. If someone manually overrides the value, the value returned by the routing endpoint will not be correct.

entry.title: Packaging specification determination for pick-HUs in SAP Public Cloud WM
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I‚Äôm working with SAP Public Cloud WM and I‚Äôd like to clarify how packaging specifications are determined when creating a pick-HU for an outbound delivery.

From what I‚Äôve found in the documentation:

  • Packaging spec profiles like PB_EWM_GRP, PB_EWM_GRV, SPB_EWM_DEC, SPB_EWM_INB, and SPB_EWM_OUT exist but can‚Äôt be created or extended.

  • Packing with packaging specs seems possible in an outbound delivery using the ‚ÄúPack Handling Unit ‚Äì Advanced‚Äù app.

  • However, during RF picking, the system requires a manual entry of a packaging material to create a pick-HU (ad-hoc).

So my understanding is:
üëâ It‚Äôs not possible to determine packaging specifications for pick-HUs created during picking.

Is that correct? Has anyone managed to determine pick-HUs automatically based on packaging specs in SAP Public Cloud WM?

entry.title: Why does MRP change BOM of a rework production order with discontinued material?
entry.content:
Dear Community, 

We created a rework production order to rework a material 150A to 150B. The material 150A that is to be reworked has a successor entry 150B in the master data, please see screen copy2.

Example: Rework order 6001880 in the screen copy 1

Task: Take material 150A quantity 3 and produce 3 times material 150B from it

Discontinuation date material 150A: 02.07.2025

Creation of the rework order: 15.10.2025

It looks like SAP has changed the material and quantities in the rework order to use up exisiting 150A (as desired) and the successor 150B (does not make any sense).

At time of the release of the rework order, there were enough parts 150A in free stock. We assume that the system has changed the quantities automatically, as the free stock has been reduced in the meantime.

Now we wonder if this is a MRP problem or wrong settings in the master data. We can't check for every MRP run to see if the system makes changes to rework orders when free stock situation changes.

Anyideas on this behaviour? What must be changed to avoid this?

I apologize the screen copies are in German language only.

Thank you.

Regards,

Dirk

entry.title: Lease in Accounting | Quarterly periodic posting
entry.content:
Hi all,

 

How can we invoice/pay quarterly in a lease contract for each Object/Condition?

We receive Supplier Invoice and we are using scanning, how the system will work out the postings from S4 (Periodic Postings) and the invoice we receive? This seems to be a limitation in the system.

 

Regards

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: #COE#RFL01- How to neutralize free Payment
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community ! 
I need to configure payment methods so that they cannot be used for FREE PAYMENT, but only for automatic payments in S/4HANA Cloud Public.
Has anyone else done this configuration before?

I deleted the clearing account, but that doesn't completely block the free payments.

Thank you very much for your help. 

Best regards, 

Mouna

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Finance 

FIN Accounts Receivable and Payable

entry.title: Wave templates in WM SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

I am maintaining wave templates in SAP Public Cloud WM as follows

Then scheduled the wave creation:

Question is, why system includes to wave PDO's with goods issue date 11.11?

There are fields to select request items but no option to make the for example GI date as dynamic?

In this case I would like to select only PDO items where GI date is 4.11..

entry.title: Alternate Reconciliation Account and¬†Overwriting control accounts initiated by MM through ERS
entry.content:
I would like to ask the expert advice regarding "Alternate Reconciliation Account and Overwriting Reconciliation Accounts initiated by MM through ERS" .
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/0c67c30acde9468b9f1a43cae130a5a7.html?locale=en-US&version=LATESThttps://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/0c67c30acde9468b9f1a43cae130a5a7.html?locale=en-US

Query:
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud,it appears to be explained that the use of alternate reconciliation accounts for control accounts from ERS(F1683) is not possible. I would like to inquire about the following:

  1. Is there a BAdI or similar functionality that exists for modifying liability details automatically recorded from ERS?
  2. Is it possible to forcibly overwrite reconciliation accounts by using Open FI?
    I would appreciate any guidance you can provide on this topic.
    Thank you for your support & Kindly Regards,

Koji Mikami

P.S
I discovered and tested the BAdI (MRM_ERS_DATA_Modify_CE), but Reconciliation Accounts were not included in the Changing Parameters. If there are any other methods, please let me know. Also, is there a possibility that an Alternate Reconciliation Account could be used in the future from ERS?
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/5a27c5f57c3f4dffa6881ca587b22571.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

entry.title: Calculation formulas for Statistical Key Figures in manufacturing overhead allocation
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We are implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for a manufacturing company and planning to use Statistical Key Figures for overhead cost allocation (e.g., allocating indirect costs based on production quantity, machine hours, inspection counts, etc.).

Could you please advise on the following:
1. What types of calculation formulas are available for Statistical Key Figures in overhead cost allocation?
2. Besides "Period-based Activity Price" and "Average Price", are there other calculation methods available?
3. In on-premise SAP, we used KP06 (cost input), KP26 (quantity input), and KSPI (price calculation) to automatically calculate activity prices. Is there an equivalent workflow in Public Edition?
4. If calculation formulas can be configured, which Scope Item and which Fiori app should be used for this setup?

Any guidance on activity-based costing setup in Public Edition would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Managing unconfirmed receivables/payables (before invoice posting) for cash flow forecasting
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We would like to reflect unconfirmed payment schedules (before Customer Invoice or Supplier Invoice posting) from purchase orders and sales orders into our cash flow forecast.

Specifically, we need to capture:
- Expected payment dates from purchase orders (before Supplier Invoice is posted)
- Expected receipt dates from sales orders (before Customer Invoice is posted)

Could you please advise:
1. Which Scope Item(s) support this functionality?
2. Which Fiori app(s) can be used to view/manage these unconfirmed payment schedules?
3. Can these schedules be automatically integrated with Cash Management for liquidity forecasting?
4. Which license is required for this functionality:
- "Basic Cash Management" or
- "SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (for Cash Management)"?
(Also, are these two licenses corresponding to Base Bundle and Premium Bundle respectively?)

Any guidance on extracting pending receivables/payables for cash flow planning would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Updating Custom Fields in Journal Entry in S4 Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to check if there is a way to update the Journal Entry custom fields after creating checks in Manage Outgoing Checks.
I have tested all available Journal Entry custom logic options, but none of them are triggered or update the custom fields.

I need this for a custom report in Create Correspondence, where the data from Manage Outgoing Checks must be reflected in the Journal Entry custom fields.

if you have any recommendations or alternative solutions, please let me know.

Thank you.

entry.title: Automatic bank statement import for Japanese banks in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi Community,

We need to automatically import bank statements from Japanese banks into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for bank reconciliation.

Could you please advise:
1. Is automatic bank statement import supported for Japanese banks (e.g., MUFG, Mizuho, SMBC)?
2. Which connectivity method is supported:
- Bank Communication Management with Zengin format (Zengin TCP/IP or Zengin XML)?
- SWIFT/MT940?
- File upload (manual or SFTP)?
3. Which Scope Item(s) and Fiori app(s) should be used for this setup?
4. Are there any successful implementation cases with Japanese banks?

Any insights on Japanese bank integration would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Cash Management feature comparison: License types and Scope Items
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I'm trying to understand the Cash Management capabilities in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. According to the Help Portal (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/186460fdc35a4b64a713da9bb00deb1e/c7999f525c5b224fe10000000a445394.html), there are two different classifications:

**Scope Items:**
- Basic Cash Management
- SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (for Cash Management)

**License Bundles:**
- Finance Base
- Finance Premium

Could you please clarify:
1. What is the relationship between these Scope Items and License Bundles?
(e.g., Does "Basic Cash Management" correspond to "Finance Base"?)
2. What are the specific 3-digit Scope Item IDs (S-IDs) included in each Scope Item and License Bundle?
3. What are the key functional differences in Cash Flow Management across these combinations?

Any guidance or documentation references would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Finished Good and Co-/By-Product Valuated at Zero After Production ‚Äì Moving Average Price
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm currently working on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Manufacturing scenario) and I‚Äôm facing an issue with the inventory valuation after production.

Here is the situation:

  • I have a Finished Good (FG) with a Co-Product and a By-Product (used as a Semi-Finished Good).

  • I generated the BOM which includes the required raw materials.

  • In the Work Center, I assigned:

    • A Cost Center

    • Activity Types (Setup Time, Machine Time, Person Time)

    • Corresponding Rates for each activity type

  • I created a Production Order and during confirmation, the system correctly calculates the total cost (Raw Materials + Setup + Machine + Labor).

  • The cost of the FG and Co-Product is displayed correctly in the production order.

However, after performing the Goods Receipt (GR) for the FG and Co-Product, when I check the Inventory Valuation, I find that both are valuated at zero.
In the Production Order, the costs are correct, but the material valuation in stock is 0.

 

My Question:

How can I configure the system so that it updates the material valuation after production?
Is there any specific step or configuration (for example, settlement or revaluation process) required to make the inventory value reflect the actual production cost?

Note: I‚Äôm using Moving Average Price (V) as the control price for these materials.

Additional Info:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

  • Scenario: Production Order with Co-Products and By-Products

  • BOM and routing correctly maintained

  • Activity rates assigned in the work center

Thanks in advance for your help!
Any insight into configuration or post-processing steps would be appreciated.

entry.title: Multi-level sales order BOM
entry.content:
Hello,

Is there any way to create multi-level order BOM on standard SAP Public Cloud?
As far as I know, app Manage Order Bill Of Material (F4339A) only allows single level for sales order-specific BOM.

In details, their finished products consists of different components which are configurable or size-variable depending on customers' request. However client does not want to use variant configuration. And Public Cloud system does not allow more than 99 BOM alternatives and 99 group counters (please correct me if I'm wrong). That's why I am thinking of sales BOM. But now sales BOM seems not to be able to solve client's 6-level BOM.

Thanks in advanced.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Challenges with Deleting Former Employee Data and Configuring Retention Periods
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm currently looking for ways to anonymize or delete data of former employees from our system, but I‚Äôve encountered a few challenges along the way.

We‚Äôd like to define different retention periods for our various ticket categories, but so far, we haven‚Äôt found any option to configure this. Of course, during the implementation project, we already activated the available setting for the general retention period.

The ‚ÄúData Protection and Privacy‚Äù work center is also activated; however, manually deleting more than 1,000 records would be far too time-consuming. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre hoping to find a way to automate this, ideally based on the report we created ‚Äì or through a similar approach.

An example: There are former employees who have neither created nor participated in any tickets. To identify them, I‚Äôve created a report. Based on this report, we‚Äôd like to delete those former employees.

Does anyone know how we could implement this ‚Äì or perhaps have a better idea?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Depreciation Keys Mexico
entry.content:
In the Public Cloud, we cannot create our own depreciation keys. For Mexico, the system currently provides:

  • MF05 ‚Äì Straight-line 5.00% Mexico

  • ML10 ‚Äì Straight-line 10.00% Mexico

  • ML20 ‚Äì Straight-line 20.00% Mexico

However, we would also like to have 25%, 30%, and 35%.
Does anyone know a pragmatic solution for this?

entry.title: Customer reference copy from service confirmation to billing document
entry.content:
Dear community,

we want to copy the customer reference number from service confirmation to billing document in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

For that we use the BAdi SD_BIL_DATA_TRANSFER. When we use the following code it works fine:

bil_doc_res-purchaseorderbycustomer = 'Customer Reference'.

After we want to query the data (customer reference - purchaseorderbycustomer) from service confirmation we are not able to get data from related CDS view i_serviceconfirmationtp.

Has anyone an idea how this could work? Do we have to create a new custom CDS? If yes, with which datasource? Or is there an easier way?

Every hint would be much appreciated.

Thx

entry.title: Good receipt and label printing for mixed purchase orders
entry.content:
Dear community,

we often have the issue of purchase orders with mixed item positions: Regular production material mixed with free text orders from purchase requisitions of end users in one purchase order.

‚ÄÉIn this case there is no label printing possible for regular production material during goods reciept, only a document for Goods Receipt for PO is printed.

The workaround is to post incoming goods in 2 steps, 1st all freetext order items and 2nd all regular production material. But this means one must look into the entire item list of the purchase order to identify the freetext items, this is somehow cumbersome and laborious.

Is there a smarter way to achieve the printing of goods receipt labels for mixed purchase orders?

Thank you.

BR

Dirk
